_header: Mary Mother well Thee be / Mother and Maiden think on me
Title(s): ‘An Orisoun to þe fyue Ioyes of vre lady’
Subjects: Virgin Mary, joys of; prayers, to Virgin Mary
_description: ‘An Orisoun to þe fyue Ioyes of vre lady’ — eight 6-line stanzas

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
MArie Modur wel þe beeModur and Mayden þenk on
                    me…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…And let me neuer for no synneffor go þat Ioye þat
                    þou art InneAmen par Charite Aue
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.
BodEngPoeta1.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Minor Poems of the Vernon Manuscript, Part 1.
EETS
         o.s. 98 (1892; repr. 1973): 133-4.
Patterson,  Frank A. 
             The Middle English Penitential Lyric.
Columbia University Studies in English.
         New York: Columbia Press, 1911: 144-5.

EDU114.First Lines:
Mary þat hath no p[ ]Here to day my prey[ ]Thow y
                    vnworthy beTo þe y dare i calle…
EDU114.Note:
Lines 1-24 only; damaged by damp. This occurs on the rear fly
                    leaf.
EDU114.Editions:
Borland,  Katherine R. 
             A Descriptive Catalogue of the Western Medieval Manuscripts in
                Edinburgh University Library
         Edinburgh: University Press, 1916: 335.

Longleat30.First Lines:
MAry moder mayden mekeffor þat ioy I the
                    beseke…
Longleat30.Last Lines:
…In to lyȝt & iolyte þou bringe vs alle with
                    theTo reste with outen ende AmenAue maria gracia plena dominus
                        tecum
Longleat30.Note:
Incomplete: missing stanzas 1, 2 and 8 but here treated as if complete
                    (no missing folios or spaces for missing stanzas); rubric Latin heading
                        ‘Aue maria gracia plena dominus tecum’ follows each
                    stanza.

HunHM142.First Lines:
MAry moder mayden mekeffor þat ioy I the
                    beseke…
HunHM142.Last Lines:
…In to light and iolyte þou brynge us all with þeTo
                    reste with owten ende
HunHM142.Note:
Incomplete: missing stanzas 1, 2 and 8 but here treated as if complete
                    (no missing folios or spaces for missing stanzas); rubric Latin headings for
                    each stanza.
HunHM142.Editions:
Schulz,  Herbert. C., Norma B. Cuthbert,   and  Naydée Noya.  
             Ten Centuries of Manuscripts in the Huntington Library.
         San Marino, CA: Huntington Library, 1962: 459-60.

BrusselsIV231.First Lines:
MAry moder well the beMaide and moder thenk on
                    me…
BrusselsIV231.Last Lines:
…Amen amen so mote hyt beSwete lady pur
                    chariteMary moder and maide cleneSchylde me to day fro sorow &
                    tene
